channel.title: Comments on: Prologue, A WordPress Theme

item.title: By: Pam
item.dc:creator: Pam
item.description:
I like your prologue theme and think it is really easy to use with the cleaver posting box when you're logged into your blog.
-Pam
item.content:encoded:
I like your prologue theme and think it is really easy to use with the cleaver posting box when you’re logged into your blog.

-Pam

item.title: By: Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: I'm really liking the idea of being able to just post my new entries right on the page without having to go through the whole dashboard ordeal everytime. Keep up the great work!
item.content:encoded: I’m really liking the idea of being able to just post my new entries right on the page without having to go through the whole dashboard ordeal everytime. Keep up the great work!

item.title: By: Nick
item.dc:creator: Nick
item.description: I like Prologue. it looks good and it seems to be very versatile.
item.content:encoded: I like Prologue. it looks good and it seems to be very versatile.

item.title: By: Aku
item.dc:creator: Aku
item.description: Thanks for the links on this theme. Looks like a good twitter user model. Glad there is another way downloading this than the subversion model.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the links on this theme. Looks like a good twitter user model. Glad there is another way downloading this than the subversion model.

item.title: By: Patient Jones
item.dc:creator: Patient Jones
item.description: I have also checked several blogs running Prologue couldnt replicate the issue.
item.content:encoded: I have also checked several blogs running Prologue couldnt replicate the issue.

item.title: By: Darren Evans
item.dc:creator: Darren Evans
item.description: I have also checked several blogs running Prologue couldn't replicate the issue. I think I found one that has the problem you describe. The URL for the tag feeds have all been incorrect.
item.content:encoded: I have also checked several blogs running Prologue couldn’t replicate the issue. I think I found one that has the problem you describe. The URL for the tag feeds have all been incorrect.

item.title: By: alex
item.dc:creator: alex
item.description:
________________ i didnt think that was going to format right.. ugh.
basically, i changed this:
echo get_tag_feed_link ($tag->term_id)
to:
echo $tag_link . '/feed'
(trying again) __________
Thanks!!!!
item.content:encoded:
________________
i didnt think that was going to format right.. ugh.

basically, i changed this:

echo get_tag_feed_link ($tag->term_id)

to:

echo $tag_link . ‘/feed’

(trying again)
__________

Thanks!!!!

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description: The current version of Prologue is available for download at http://wordpress.org/extend/themes/prologue
item.content:encoded: The current version of Prologue is available for download at http://wordpress.org/extend/themes/prologue

item.title: By: Thank You Silahsiz Kuvvetler for Showing Me the Light | I'd Rather Be Writing - Tom Johnson
item.dc:creator: Thank You Silahsiz Kuvvetler for Showing Me the Light | I'd Rather Be Writing - Tom Johnson
item.description: [...] theme called Prologue, which might provide an alternative. Coincidentally, Prologue was coded by Joseph Scott, a bug exorcist for Automattic who happens to live nearby and who I often talk with at local [...]
item.content:encoded: […] theme called Prologue, which might provide an alternative. Coincidentally, Prologue was coded by Joseph Scott, a bug exorcist for Automattic who happens to live nearby and who I often talk with at local […]

item.title: By: KabonFootprint
item.dc:creator: KabonFootprint
item.description: Hi Joseph, I just ran into your blog. Probably will use this on my wordpress.com account. But am still waiting if you would post the .zip file so I can safe it on my PC also. Personally don't really like the Subversion method. Let me know. Thanks.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Joseph,
I just ran into your blog. Probably will use this on my wordpress.com account. But am still waiting if you would post the .zip file so I can safe it on my PC also. Personally don’t really like the Subversion method.
Let me know. Thanks.
